TopicTitle: What have you been playing recently? (Other than KSP)

Articles.Content:
Outer Wilds. Better than sliced bread and tied for first place with KSP.

Get it, go in blind, and PM me for vague hints when you get stuck.

You will not regret playing it, but you undoubtedly will regret spoiling any puzzles for yourself.

On 12/27/2019 at 3:32 AM, Lapis said:

if you want something a bit more challenging tray some paradox games; My favorite is hearts of iron.

I just got Stellaris(but not often played than KSP) and messing around marauding empire

I got PC game pass and so far am loving it. Played minit, Outer Worlds (not wilds) and Sea Of Thieves.

Minit is a nice little RPG distraction game where the hook is, you die and restart after a minute of gameplay. It was fun, but I beat it in about 2 hours so I'm glad I got it for "free"

Outer worlds is Fallout in space. You'll know if you'll like it our not based on that. I like it.

Not sure on Sea Of Thieves yet. Spent about 6 hours in it with friends and if I have to put that much time into it very often I'm going to have to hard pass.

Edited February 12, 2020 by 5thHorseman
I've been playing RDR2 recently, and have just got to the point where they move from Horseshoe Creek.
Still hammering on Skyrim V.

Touhou 15: Legacy of Lunatic Kingdom

Beat pointdevice mode in 4 hours over 3 days on easy. (Yeah yeah, I’m an elementary schooler now I guess)

ZUN, I’m pretty sure you just shoehorned pointdevice mode in at the last second because I can tell that the stage 5 and stage 6 boss were clearly designed for multiple lives.

Baldur's Gate 1.

Love DND & crpgs. Also I play Nethack, super old school dungeon crawler. You die. A *lot*.
Recently, I received a Nintendo Switch, so lots of Super Smash Bros. Ultimate and Mariokart 8 Deluxe. Two very fun games!
Factorio Beta 0.18 just dropped. So I've been playing that to the exclusion of all else.

Goat simulator.

Spoiler

I give up
Factorio. I, too, have been lost to the beast. Except that I modded it, and so everything is more complicated.

Visual Studio for Mac, mainly… Better graphics, but sometimes I miss the smaller memory footprint from MonoDevelop.

(weird enough, MonoDevelop never crashed on me, VS however already crashed twice…)
In similar spirits to Lisias I've spent a considerable time in Notepad++ recently.

Civilization. No, not Sid Meier's Civilization, Avalon Hill's Advanced Civilization. My wife was joking over the weekend that we should let our kids experience the, "joy of Source of the Nile." So, I dug out my copy and we played. (And, once again, my wife inexplicably didn't make it more than two hexes into her expedition before it was wiped out by a random event and she died. That game hates her.) But while I was digging around in the back of the game cupboard, I saw my board game copy of Advanced Civilization and sighed. When I brought it up with my wife she said that while the kids are pretty precocious they may not be ready for a board game that takes 10-12 hours to finish. So instead, to satisfy my craving, I dug up my 25-year-old copy of the computer version, installed it under DosBox, and went at it. I'm killing it as Crete right now, they're my peeps.

On 2/2/2020 at 2:23 AM, IncongruousGoat said:

Factorio. I, too, have been lost to the beast. Except that I modded it, and so everything is more complicated.

Factorio is like KSP in that there are 2 main categories of mods: Those that make the game easier to use, and those that make the game harder to play.

I like both types of mods in both types of games

Mount&Blade:Warband

P:S Can't Wait for the release of KSP2 and Bannerlord

On 2/9/2020 at 11:47 AM, Satellitefanatic said:

Bannerlord

Gimme the sales pitch, I'm intrigued.

On 2/9/2020 at 11:47 AM, Satellitefanatic said:

KSP2

The time investment required to prune mods every update has made me go offline starting 1.6. I am emphatically not buying KSP 2 any time soon.

3 hours ago, DDE said:

Gimme the sales pitch, I'm intrigued.

Ever wanted to be a medieval warlord, just prancing on your pony, looting and pillaging local villages? Bannerlord

Perhaps you wanted to be a noble, collect an army and overthrow the king? Bannerlord

Maybe you are more inclined to scheme behind everyone's back, so you marry into a noble family and climb the social ladder? Bannerlord

Or if you prefer riches over fame, just build a trading empire, supplemented by global monopoly in silk production. Bannerlord

130+ hours wasted into Factorio, much to my wife's disgust...

Note to self: unload nuclear-tipped rockets from the rocket launcher when done nuking bug bases, so that you don't accidentally nuke a tree )and yourself) when trying to shoot it out of the way....
Terminal
